bunpro.writeup: その結果is aconjunctionin Japanese that is used to highlight the result of something that has been previously said. Thenoun結果itself means 'result'. This expression translates as 'as a result of (A)', or 'resulting from (A)'.その結果will be used at the beginning of a new sentence, before a (B) phrase will highlight the result of (A).その結果may be used to highlight either positive, or negative results interchangeably. However, the (B) part of the sentence almost always focuses on a new 'situation' or 'condition' that has been created due to (A).

examples.japanese: 学校を3か月休んだ。その結果、皆と卒業することができなかった。
examples.english: I took three months off from school. As a result, I was not able to graduate with everyone.

examples.japanese: 日焼け止めを塗らずにビーチで一日過ごした。その結果凄く日焼けをして、しばらくシャワーに入るのが辛かった。
examples.english: I spent the whole day at the beach without sunscreen. As a result, I got a bad sunburn and it was painful to take a shower for a while.

examples.japanese: 毎日朝早くから夜遅くまで練習した。その結果、試合で優勝することができた。
examples.english: We practiced every day from early in the morning to late at night. As a result, we were able to win the tournament.

examples.japanese: タナカ君は一年間運動をしないでゲームばっかりしていた。その結果20-キロも太った。
examples.english: Tanaka-kun only played video games without exercising for a year. As a result, he gained 20 kilograms.

examples.japanese: 2ヶ月間ずっと体を鍛え続けていた。その結果、筋肉が増えた。
examples.english: I continuously trained for a solid two months. As a result I gained muscle.

examples.japanese: 高校の頃、５か月間入院をした。その結果、留年することになった。
examples.english: During my high school days, I was hospitalized for 5 months. As a result, I ended up repeating a year.

examples.japanese: 昨日、髪の毛が濡れたままで寝た。その結果、風邪を引いた。
examples.english: Last night I went to bed with wet hair. As a result I caught a cold.

examples.japanese: 夜更かしをした。その結果、遅刻した。
examples.english: I stayed up till late. As a result, I was late.

examples.japanese: 日本語能力試験を受けるまでに彼は毎週日本語の小説を2冊読んだ。その結果、読解で満点を取った。
examples.english: Before taking the JLPT, he read two Japanese novels a week. As a result, he got full marks on the reading section.

false_friends.meaning: Accordingly, Now, Therefore, To that end
Due to, Because of, As a result of
For that reason, Because of that, To that end
